original:
Huntington disease is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by progressive neurodegeneration. While individuals with the affected genotype typically exhibit symptoms, it is noteworthy that up to 25% may not develop any signs until after the age of 50. This delayed onset can complicate the understanding of Mendelian inheritance patterns associated with the condition.
